column4: hrm. hrmrhmrhrmhrmrhm. ok. I am trying to use gftp like winscp - but I get a connection reset by peer each time it tries to initialize and send the password... I can ssh no problem to this machine, why would an ssh2 copy fail?
(I can winscp to this machine too)
what else can I use in lieu of winscp? I've read ubuntu forums, they say secpanel (?) nautilus (doesn't work...) and gftp.. (no worky). Do I need to manually setup the certificates for this to work?
does anyone scp from ubuntu? hrm. nautilus and gftp fail. why would winscp work without any hassle? From ubuntu I can ssh fine to this machine...
I use scp all the time
if you told me what app you use (just scp cli?) that would help
I just type scp from bash why do you ask?
I am looking for a winscp type app. scp from cli is broken for humans
from what I have seen, it might be command line, but it isn't an interface. it doesn't even spawn an interactive shell...
no it is old school no gui
still let's send two files by scp -but I am still looking for this supposed nautilus and gftp support, but it fails on my machine... connection reset by peer... o.0 ssh works to this machine
I am not talking about no gui, I am talking about a broken cli
...22 right?
try 'scp -p[PORT] [USERNAME]@[HOST]:/filepathtoget .' for a get command
try 'scp -p[PORT] myfile [USERNAME]@[HOST]:/filepathtosend' for a push command
I know the scp command line - but it isn't usable... or productive
whereas the ftp command line is usable and productive, as it also has a shell
yes, but the ftp uses port 21
make sure shorewall or whatever it is ubuntu uses these days for a firewall has the right ports open

.... I know... what are you saying... port numbers don't dictate whether or not an application will be written to human based guidelines... ftp is a usable command, scp is an abhorrent example of how to mess up something simple... but let me send these two files and see if it does indeed support what I want (at least if I can hack up some shell magic to send multiple files)
OO, sorry, my server is crashed
so scp works, gftp doesn't although the site says 'ssh and ssh2 transfers' there is only an ssh2 option in my window...
no keys, I asked higher up if that could be the problem
